description.lang: FEATURES:- Z-Wave on/off control of up to 5 electrical devices- On/off (charging/charged) reports from USB ports to the hub (no Z-Wave control) - turn off the charging device for best results- Energy monitoring for each of the 5 outlets- Built-in overload protection and ETL certification- Z-Wave Plus signal repeater to extend network range- S2 security protocol and the latest 500 Z-Wave chip for faster and safer wireless communicationSPECS:- Model Number: ZEN20 VER. 2.0- Z-Wave Signal Frequency: 908.42 MHz- Power: 120 VAC- Maximum Load: 15 A total (between 5 outlets)- Maximum Load for USB ports: 2.1 A total (between 2 ports)- Cord Length: 2 feet- Range: Up to 100 feet line of sight- Installation and Use: Indoor only
Z-Wave Plus Lifeline

name.lang: On/Off Status Recovery Aer Power Failure

description.lang: Choose the recovery state for your Power Strips outlets ifpower outage occurs.
Power Strip remembers the status for each outlet prior to power outage and turns back to it
Power Strip automatically turns ON for each outlet once power is restored (it does not remember the status prior to power outage)
Power Strip automatically turns OFF each outlet once power is restored (it does not remember the status prior to power outage)

name.lang: Enable/ Disable Auto Turn-Off Timer for CH2

description.lang: Use this parameter to enable or disable the auto turn-offtimer for CH2 outlet.
timer disabled
timer enabled

name.lang: Set Auto Turn-Off Timer for CH2

description.lang: Use this parameter to set the time after which you want thedevice connected to CH2 outlet to automatically turn off once it has beenturned on. The number entered as value corresponds to the number ofminutes.
minutes

name.lang: Enable/ Disable Auto Turn-On Timer for CH2

description.lang: Use this parameter to enable or disable the auto turn-ontimer for CH2 outlet.
timer disabled
timer enabled

name.lang: Set Auto Turn-On Timer for CH2

description.lang: Use this parameter to set the time after which you want thedevice connected to CH2 outlet to automatically turn on once it has beenturned off. The number entered as value corresponds to the number ofminutes.
minutes

name.lang: Enable/ Disable Auto Turn-Off Timer for CH3

description.lang: Use this parameter to enable or disable the auto turn-offtimer for CH3 outlet.
timer disabled
timer enabled

name.lang: Set Auto Turn-Off Timer for CH3

description.lang: Use this parameter to set the time after which you want thedevice connected to CH3 outlet to automatically turn off once it has beenturned on. The number entered as value corresponds to the number ofminutes.
minutes

name.lang: Enable/ Disable Auto Turn-On Timer for CH3

description.lang: Use this parameter to enable or disable the auto turn-ontimer for CH3 outlet.
timer disabled
timer enabled

name.lang: Set Auto Turn-On Timer for CH3

description.lang: Use this parameter to set the time after which you want thedevice connected to CH3 outlet to automatically turn on once it has beenturned off. The number entered as value corresponds to the number ofminutes.
minutes

name.lang: Enable/ Disable Auto Turn-Off Timer for CH4

description.lang: Use this parameter to enable or disable the auto turn-offtimer for CH4 outlet.
timer disabled
timer enabled

name.lang: Set Auto Turn-Off Timer for CH4

description.lang: Use this parameter to set the time after which you want thedevice connected to CH4 outlet to automatically turn off once it has beenturned on. The number entered as value corresponds to the number ofminutes.
minutes

name.lang: Power Wattage Report Value Threshold

description.lang: Choose how you want your Power Strip to report powerconsumption to your hub. The number entered as value corresponds tothe number of Watts the appliance needs to go over for the change to bereported. So if 5 Watts are entered by default, the smart plug will reportany change in power usage over 5 Watts for each outlet (whether its atleast 5 Watts more or 5 Watts less compared to previous report).
Power meter disabled
Watts

name.lang: Enable/ Disable Auto Turn-On Timer for CH4

description.lang: Use this parameter to enable or disable the auto turn-ontimer for CH4 outlet.
timer disabled
timer enabled

name.lang: Set Auto Turn-On Timer for CH4

description.lang: Use this parameter to set the time after which you want thedevice connected to CH4 outlet to automatically turn on once it has beenturned off. The number entered as value corresponds to the number ofminutes.
minutes

name.lang: Enable/ Disable Auto Turn-Off Timer for CH5

description.lang: Use this parameter to enable or disable the auto turn-offtimer for CH5 outlet.
timer disabled
timer enabled

name.lang: Set Auto Turn-Off Timer for CH5

description.lang: Use this parameter to set the time after which you want thedevice connected to CH5 outlet to automatically turn off once it has beenturned on. The number entered as value corresponds to the number ofminutes.
minutes

name.lang: Enable/ Disable Auto Turn-On Timer for CH5

description.lang: Use this parameter to enable or disable the auto turn-ontimer for CH5 outlet.
timer disabled
timer enabled

name.lang: Set Auto Turn-On Timer for CH5

description.lang: Use this parameter to set the time after which you want thedevice connected to CH5 outlet to automatically turn on once it has beenturned off. The number entered as value corresponds to the number ofminutes.
minutes

name.lang: Manual Control

description.lang: Choose if you want to use the physical buttons on Strip toturn the outlets on or off manually or if you want to disable this function. Ifthis parameter is set to 0 (disabled), you will only be able to turn any of theoutlets on or off remotely using your Z-Wave gateway controller.
manual control disabled for all outlets
manual control enabled for all outlets

name.lang: LED Indicator Mode

description.lang: Choose if you want the LED indicators next to each outlet tocome on when power is on or off, or if you want to disable the LED lights.
LED indicator is on when power is of and off when power is on
LED indicator is on when power is on and off when power is off
LED indicator is always off, regardless of power status.

name.lang: Power Wattage Report Frequency

description.lang: The number entered as value corresponds to the number ofseconds. So if 30 is entered by default, the Strip will report powerconsumption (Wattage) every 30 seconds.
seconds

name.lang: Energy (kWh) Report Frequency

description.lang: Choose how oen you want your Power Strip to report powerconsumption (W) to your controller (hub). The number entered as valuecorresponds to the number of seconds. So if 300 is entered by default, thepower strip will report energy usage every 300 seconds (5 minutes).

name.lang: Overload Protection

description.lang: Set the Watt level for overload protection to kick in. Thenumber entered as the value corresponds to the total number of Watts theStrip needs to detect across all 5 outlets to turn off automatically and senda notification to the hub.
overload protection disabled
Watts

name.lang: Enable/ Disable Auto Turn-Off Timer for CH1

description.lang: Use this parameter to enable or disable the auto turn-offtimer for CH1 outlet. If this feature is enabled, the device connected toCH1 outlet will automatically turn off after a fixed period of time frombeing turned on (set in parameter 7).
timer disabled
timer enabled

name.lang: Set Auto Turn-Off Timer for CH1

description.lang: Use this parameter to set the time after which you want thedevice connected to CH1 outlet to automatically turn off once it has beenturned on. The number entered as value corresponds to the number ofminutes.
minutes

name.lang: Enable/ Disable Auto Turn-On Timer for CH1

description.lang: Use this parameter to enable or disable the auto turn-ontimer for CH1 outlet. If this feature is enabled, the device connected toCH1 outlet will automatically turn on after a fixed period of time frombeing turned off (set in parameter 9).
timer disabled
timer enabled

name.lang: Set Auto Turn-On Timer for CH1

description.lang: Use this parameter to set the time after which you want thedevice connected to CH1 outlet to automatically turn on once it has beenturned off. The number entered as value corresponds to the number ofminutes.
minutes
